intro: Lasiosiphon anthylloides, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that resemble bells. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, which are often covered in fine, white pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is widely cultivated in gardens around the world.
